results.title: Will the Great Barrier Reef cure Claude Clough
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Milson
results.brief_description: A travel film with a difference. Claude Clough, frustrated and depressed, consults a psychiatrist who prescribes a holiday on the Great Barrier Reef. Underwater photography shows some of the dazzling coral formations and reefs and the striking scenery of the reef islands. A satirical fantasy on the theme of a holiday on the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Will it snow for Christmas? = Y aura-t-il de la niege a Noel?
results.brief_description: This is a moving story about a mother and her seven illegitimate children. But far from presenting life as a drudge, Sandrine Veysset conveys the pleasure of a children’s universe wrapped up in a land of dreams, play, and their mother’s love. Focussing on the mother’s extraordinary spirit and resilience in the face of the father’s cruelty and exploitation, this heart-rending story is set against the backdrop of changing seasons and the tough routine of farm life in the south of France. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Wilhelm scream
results.brief_description: Exhibition video created by ACMI for the Fed Square Foyer display; forefronting the use of the ‘Wilhelm Scream’ in film and TV

constellations_primary.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

results.description: First appearing in Distant Drums (1951) to express the terror of being eaten by alligators, the Wilhelm scream earned its namesake in 1953, when Private Wilhelm was shot in the leg with an arrow in The Charge at Feather River. In the 1970s, University of Southern California film students found the stock sound effect and used it in their student films. One of those students was Ben Burtt, who became sound editor on both the Star Wars and Indiana Jones franchises, and used the effect throughout each series. Other filmmakers noticed and incorporated it into their own sound design as a running industry in-joke. It’s since appeared in Titanic, Reservoir Dogs and Toy Story, as well as countless other films, TV shows and videos. Today, many people encounter the Wilhelm scream via memes, demonstrating how different forms of pop culture influence and inspire each other.
description_for_label: First appearing in Distant Drums (1951) to express the terror of being eaten by alligators, the Wilhelm scream earned its namesake in 1953, when Private Wilhelm was shot in the leg with an arrow in The Charge at Feather River. In the 1970s, University of Southern California film students found the stock sound effect and used it in their student films. One of those students was Ben Burtt, who became sound editor on both the Star Wars and Indiana Jones franchises, and used the effect throughout each series. Other filmmakers noticed and incorporated it into their own sound design as a running industry in-joke. It’s since appeared in Titanic, Reservoir Dogs and Toy Story, as well as countless other films, TV shows and videos. Today, many people encounter the Wilhelm scream via memes, demonstrating how different forms of pop culture influence and inspire each other.

results.title: Wildside. Eps. 1-2
results.creator_credit: Steve Knapman, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Jenkins
results.brief_description: Bill McCoy (Tony Martin) has come back to Sydney after a four year absence, working throughout South East Asia after retiring from the police force due to the level of police corruption and his inability to turn a blind eye. His return is triggered by a phone call from his friend and crisis worker, Syd, that his son Nick is in some kind of trouble. McCoy pays a visit to his ex-wife after having no luck locating Nick, only to be told Nick ended up in a youth detention centre, unbeknownst to Bill - his wife has no idea where their son is. In his venture to locate Nick, Bill meets Dr Maxine Summers (Rachel Blake), who runs a drop in centre for delinquent youth and is treating a young boy named Joe. Joe is a suspect in a ram-raid and car chase that ended with the death of two police officers, while at the same time the body of young boy turns up; tied, raped, tortured and his throat slit.

results.title: Wildlife wonderland
results.brief_description: A lighthearted study of the wildlife of Central Australia and tropical Queensland. Shows several varieties of lizard, goannas and snakes in the desert, the many kinds of brilliant birds - cassowaries, jabirus and water birds, parrots and bower birds - found in the rain forest. Unusual sequences are the courting dance of the brown snake, the dance of the brolgas and a fight between a kookaburra and a snake.

results.title: Wildlife ranger
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and David Haythornthwaite
results.brief_description: An insight into the difficulties faced in the daily lives of two rangers in Kakadu National Park, in the Northern Territory. The park is remote and supplies and news must come via mail plane from Darwin.. Also includes wonderful footage of Australia’s unique scenery and wildlife.

results.title: Wildlife of the Rocky Mountains
results.brief_description: After many years of careful conservation, Banff and Jasper National Parks have become vast zoological gardens. In this film you see many intimate views of the creatures of the wild, big and small, that inhabit the forested mountain slopes of these parks. Deer, moose, bear, big-horn sheep, birds and small animals that live above the tree-line are natural subjects for the close-up camera, shooting against a backdrop of snowy peaks of the Canadian Rockies.

results.title: Wildlife of the River Valley
results.brief_description: A program that presents a unique view of the enormous variety of wildlife that lives in the Bellinger River Valley, situated halfway between Sydney and Brisbane on the east coast of Australia. This is a brightly paced, entertaining and informative documentary that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages.

results.title: Wildlife of the Mountains
results.brief_description: The wild life to be found in the spectacular mountain landscape of the Waitaki water-shed in the South Island of New Zealand. Alpine flowers, native birds, and their nests, deer and fawns, the salmon coming up the river to spawn are among the beautiful creatures in this wild and isolated area.
